intro: Fimbristylis umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swamps, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of a dense, umbrella-shaped cluster of spikelets, giving it its common name. Fimbristylis umbellata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
